alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 2:32PM EST until January 13 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY WEATHER EXPECTED TO BRING SLIPPERY CONDITIONS TO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT... .A mix of snow and light freezing rain is expected the rest of this afternoon and into this evening, eventually changing to all rain, heavy at times overnight. Snow will accumulate several inches in the mountains and foothills. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 7 inches and ice accumulations around one tenth to one quarter inch. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate snow mixing with freezing rain will combine with low visibility to create hazardous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
